title: Add export packaging: full source ZIP + cPanel-ready static HTML build

requirements.text: Add an in-repo export guide (EXPORT.md) that explains how to obtain (1) the full React source code as a ZIP and (2) a cPanel-ready static HTML/CSS/JS build, using clear step-by-step instructions in English.

quotes: i need whole  website file how to download i am not going to upload to cpannal'

acceptanceCriteria: Repository contains an EXPORT.md at the project root (or a clearly discoverable docs file) written in English.
EXPORT.md includes steps to: install dependencies, build the project, locate the build output folder, and create ZIP archives for both the full source and the static build.
EXPORT.md explicitly states what folder(s) to upload to cPanel for the static site (the build output directory) and that the React source itself is not directly uploadable without building.

requirements.text: Add npm scripts to generate a production static build suitable for cPanel upload and to package both deliverables (full source ZIP and static-build ZIP) in a single command.

quotes: Choose 1, 2, or 3 and I will deliver it immediately.

acceptanceCriteria: Project defines scripts to: (a) build the frontend for production, (b) create a ZIP of the build output, and (c) create a ZIP of the full project source (excluding node_modules and build artifacts).
Running the packaging script(s) produces two ZIP files with clear names (one for source, one for static build) in a documented output location.
The static build output contains an index.html and asset files that can be served by a basic static host (like cPanel) without server-side rendering.

requirements.text: Ensure the static build output uses correct relative/absolute asset paths so that it works when hosted from a typical cPanel public_html root (no broken links to CSS/JS/images).

quotes: Convert your whole website into HTML files for cPanel

acceptanceCriteria: After building, opening the generated index.html via a static server shows the same single-page marketing site layout (Header, Hero, About, Collections, Why Shop With Us, Contact, Footer).
Hero background and logo load correctly from the generated/static assets (e.g., /assets/generated/*) without 404s in the built output.
Anchor navigation (#about, #collections, #contact) works in the built static output.

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or any files under frontend/src/components/ui.
Keep the backend as a single Motoko actor; do not add backend dependencies for export/packaging.
Do not introduce third-party authentication beyond Internet Identity (no Auth0, Google, etc.).
nonGoals: Do not implement GoDaddy DNS/domain-connection automation inside the app.
Do not add dynamic backend features (orders, cart, database, admin panel) as part of this request.
Do not change existing marketing content/branding unless required to fix the static build output.
